website_summaries.verdict: Remarkably inexpensive for their well-regarded reviews, these simple massage rollers will do the trick.
pros: Designed for multi-function use on clothing, bare skin, and massage oils
Constructed with a 360-degree spin design for a hassle-free massage
Includes an opening at the bottom of the product for buyers who want to insert oils or lotions
cons: Slides around if placed on floor
A few customers complained that the hand-grip design made it difficult to apply pressure

customer_reviews.title: Need minor modification if you want to roll over it to massage a hard to reach area
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my persistent back pain but found the entire structure ends up moving instead of just the balls because the bottom stationary part is not completely flat. Fixed the structures snugly on a piece of styrofoam as shown / works perfect now for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Feel very good on tight or sore muscles.
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Easy to apply as much pressure as you want without your fingers getting tired. My husband isn’t good at giving massages. Haha. But he can with these. You can use on your own muscles (that you can reach) they just roll around themselves in the casing that you hold on to. Use oil/lotion or not. You can wash them off. They sell them at a local massage spa for twice as much and it’s the exact same product.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to use on my head and temples. I needed something that would apply pressure, not simply massage/stimulate, and came across these. They are absolutely perfect, and I can't believe they're so inexpensive (I paid $11.99 for two). The ball appears to be the same thing a bowling ball is made from, the base is very ergonomic, and there's also a rubber ring to help grip it. I've rolled it all over my face, head, neck, and shoulders, and I can apply so much more pressure than simply using my fingers, which tire fast. I just got it yesterday, and have barely put it down. Five starts all the way.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and makes my back and shoulders feel much better.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Two good little rollers for muscle pain or sciatic nerve pain
customer_reviews.text: For me it's sciatica but when I use a ball to roll the muscle, the pain doesn't go away but it definitely is not very bothersome. I used to use a tennis ball on the wall; it worked but took some getting used to and you always have to make sure that the ball hits the right spot. This massages rolls where you want it to roll. It's there when I need it and works well. Have one at home and the other in the office. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Feels great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these roller massager balls. They work great for what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool! Amazing for a good neck and shoulder rub!
customer_reviews.author: SAM1248

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I just got these a few days ago, and after one short use (under two minutes), the ball doesn't roll smoothly anymore. It skips, which ends up getting skin pinched between the ball and the somewhat sharp plastic housing. And that hurts quite a bit. Bummer. They look pretty nice, but they're useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just got them and they seem to work!
customer_reviews.text: I have tendinitis in my forearms and wrists and this is a nice little tool to help relieve some of the pain. The only bad thing I have to say so far is that when I received them, one of them was scratched up all over the ball part.
customer_reviews.author: AZCA

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'm using these for their intended purpose but they're still INCREDIBLE. I put them on the floor and lay down on them to push and roll through pressure points and pain. Speaking as someone with chronic backpain these suckers are GREAT for that. They've become a part of my nightly routine. I do wish they had a gripping base for this purpose because they do tend to slide, but again I think their original purpose is different.
customer_reviews.author: Natali

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time. I’ll be returning. The space in between the ball and handle is sharp. Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dachin

customer_reviews.title: Great size! Fits in the hand nicely
customer_reviews.text: I really love the size of these massage balls. They fit in the hand nicely and take a lot of strain off your hands when giving yourself or someone else a massage!
customer_reviews.author: SpringtimeSong

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these. I have bought a couple of them
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. I have bought a couple of them. I have one at work, in the car, at home. These are the best and you can't beat the price
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: These massage balls are amazing. I got the 2 pack and they work ...
customer_reviews.text: These massage balls are amazing. I got the 2 pack and they work great on my sore legs after a long work out. The ball is made of a smooth plastic and it rolls smoothly over sore spots. The massage fits right into the hand so u can use it palms down.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Rich

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Made very well and are so smooth when you roll them on the body.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: It does what its supposed to i guess and feels like a massaging ball rubbing up your back. It loses a star for me because the surface of the ball doesnt stick out far enough and the plastic edges rub along the skin. So if you push the ball along your back for example it sort of scrapes the skin with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ragz

customer_reviews.title: Expected to place it on the floor and roll my ...
customer_reviews.text: Expected to place it on the floor and roll my foot over it . The bottom was hard plastic and it slid when I tried to roll my foot over the ball . Unusable.
customer_reviews.author: JbAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The miracle worker
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow. I had such a crick in my neck and shoulder that I couldn’t relax my arm. My husband worked the area with the roller and what a difference it made. It really worked on that muscle and feels so much better. Definitely recommend trying this if you have a knot or tight muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but could be designed better
customer_reviews.text: These are great for getting into pressure points. I have chronic back pain, and get horrible knots under my shoulder blades. These knots often give me migraines, and as much as my husband loves me, his hands start to ache when trying to get under there and massage the knots. These are great for helping. The reason I gave them only 3 stars, is the bottom of these are slightly round and hard plastic. When trying to lay of them to diy the release of these knots, they slide across the floor instead of rolling. Makes it very difficult to use by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Momma_Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Skin gets caught. Not practical for deep tissue.
customer_reviews.text: Eh. Great in concept, but I cannot properly use it on my thighs. I'm 5'2 and weigh 125lbs, I have thick, muscular thighs and the depth of the rolling ball is not enough. My skin gets caught between the base and the ball, where I have more flesh. It works on my neck, but not my thighs, where I really need it. I didn't send it back, I'll still use it, but don't recommend it for deep tissue.
customer_reviews.author: Raphaela R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for shoulder knots
customer_reviews.text: Great for neck and trap muscles. Had neck fusion and these help with the nasty knots I get. I could take one to work and leave one at home. Take in purse or bag. Really could massage any area you can teach. Tip....if you do your neck it can grab your hair, so be careful. Great value!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Varney

customer_reviews.title: This brand pinches skin
customer_reviews.text: For this brand the ball moves in a circle as well as up and down in the socket and pinches the skin. Other brands only move in a circle and do not pinch the skin
customer_reviews.author: Jolie

customer_reviews.title: Danger
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware do not use roller ball on bare skin.After using the roller ball on my lower back I noticed that there was a huge scratch with blisters.The edge of the plastic is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: chandraf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: We got these to bring to the hospital but I wish we got these sooner! They can be used without lotion and glide easily. You dont have to put a lot of pressure to get great results and your hands dont hurt after like giving a traditional massage. Im glad we got the double pack. My husband also uses them for his knees and calves. You can also put on the floor and self-massage your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowstone

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This is by far, the best thing I've bought myself in a while. It was smaller then I anticipated but they feel amazing. They definitely will help get the knots out. The only thing negative I can say is really more of a warning...if you roll in an area with loose skin, there is a risk of pinching when you apply pressure. I absolutely love these things and the only thing that would make them better is someone else using them on you. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the set of two specifically for shoulder and neck knots. They are easy to hold even with my wrist issues from too much time playing on the phone. The balls in each one move more smoothly than I thought possible. I feared my long hair might get caught in them, but that wasn't an issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: JaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine For Me
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of neck and shoulders pain. I heard that this type of.massager can bring temporary relief. So, I chose this one. Price was low and you get two of them. Perfect size. Very comfortable to hold. Rolls nice and easy. Feels good on my neck and shoulders. Nice temporary relief. Comes in a very nice velvet like bag. My only complaint is that.both massagers are in one bag. It would be nice to have one for each piece.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useful massage tool
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a pretty useful massage tool. I like to use it on the top of my shoulders and my neck. I think it would be more useful if you could attach it to the wall and roll your back on it (leaning against a wall), I think that would feel great but you just can't use this on your own back unless you have monkey arms. Overall it's a nice tool for the price and seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Our hands usually cramp up when we we massage each other's backs and yesterday after a long day of mowing the bank of our canal our backs were killing us so we used these and it was amazing. You can lightly push or you can add more pressure for areas that need deep tissue massage. Absolutely a must to keep in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Scottkatie63

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on my husband's back It might very well be user error but it's extremely hard to use. I tend to use a lot of pressure and instead of the balls rolling, they slide across his skin. Holding them while also using pressure is also extremely difficult to control as they tend to slide in every direction except the one you were hoping it to. We tried using it about 3 times before I gave up and went back to using my hands
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Miz

customer_reviews.title: Love this, very useful tool for muscle relaxation
customer_reviews.text: My knees and legs were killing me from working them out so much lately.. so I used these with some peppermint oil. My god what a difference! it helped hit all the right spots. I have also used them on my BF's back -- he has been very tense lately and has been asking for a massage but I don't like giving them I feel I don't do them right now have the necessary hand strength ya know? So using these makes giving him massages so much easier while alleviating him of his pain!!
customer_reviews.author: Amart

customer_reviews.title: Great for our ASD son!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use as a sensory tool with our autistic son, and he loves it! Big enough for him to use it himself too... Tried it out on hubby and myself and it works so well! Great for loosening up tense muscles! My favorite Amazon find in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Works ok if you're holding it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for use on the bottom of the foot for plantar fasciitis. Unfortunately, the bottom of it is a slippery plastic so it just wants to slide across the floor rather roll under the foot. Could still probably use it if I'm holding it in one hand but there's not a lot of locations on the body that require that, where I can't use the stick or the foam roller. I should have just gotten the tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Gehrett

customer_reviews.title: Portable
customer_reviews.text: These are really useful to keep in my work bags so I can massage out sore legs. However, I wish the ball was made with a grippier substance because there is not as much traction to dig into if used over clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Better than any pick-up line!
customer_reviews.text: One for each hand, if you're lucky. Get good at using them and you'll get lucky. 2 different colors. This, I thought was weird. Comes with a drawstring bag which you will never use. My wife loves them. I've never actually felt them, but I can imagine how they feel from the moans they generate. And yes, the balls roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for easy peezy massages!
customer_reviews.text: It works. Yes. But not really with oil. The ball stop rolling if you apply oil on the skin. But does it really matter?! Also hard to put very strong pressure on it. For soft massage its awesome, but deep tissue massage, not really
customer_reviews.author: Joanny Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Fun little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I got this in conjunction with my tens unit. I got in a terrible car accident and wanted to do pain relief at home on top of my massage and chiropractic appointments. The roller ball is extremely sturdy and you can use as much or as little pressure as you need. The band creates good grip so you don’t drop it. You can also put them in the fridge for a short time for cold rolling. The bottom screws off for easy cleaning as well
customer_reviews.author: Chellsea Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: It's an okay pain reliever
customer_reviews.text: Product is okay. It works. It didn't sit well in your hand, it doesn't roll all the time. This can obviously be annoying when trying to relieve pain in muscles. It can work okay if you press hard enough just like any hard ball would. For the price it's not much of a loss, but look to but something a little more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Pain relievers!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for a quick relief. They would be even better if there was a small handle to allow even better control. Overall, these are worth the price to get a quick massage. It's better than your hand when you're trying to work out those kinks. My fiance uses these on me all the time to avoid those cramps in his hands if he's rubbing too long. He actually used these on my lower back and on my hips during labor. I loved it! :) The ball is even better when it's cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: this item is helpful if you have a pregnant woman who wants back rubs all the time. One of the massage balls had a sharp piece of plastic which was easily cut off. I didn't know it was there and it scratched her and I got yelled at which is why this is only getting 4 out of 5 stars...but it really saved my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ball is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: It feels good to massage yourself, but not good to massage other people, specially on their back. the ball is not big enough so the other person's back skin can get stuck between the handle and the ball.
customer_reviews.author: caiofogliene

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!! No joke!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the cute massaging balls. These feel STRONG and HEAVENLY massaging EVERYWHERE! I'm glad I ordered these! Anyone who knows me and my LOVE if massages knows this isn't a joke! I also ordered some balms and lotion and oils to use with...already going to Heaven while writing this 💜💚👽💯💯💃🏿🎉🎉🎉
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Walker Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Buy these NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing!! These are unreal they are so awesome. Super SMOOTH gliding and rolling. They're a little smaller than I expected, but they fit perfectly in your hand. As soon as I opened them I tried them on my boyfriend's back. Instant goosebumps he said. Then, he tried on me and ... wow! Like a deep tissue massage, but soft at the same time. They come with a little storage bag, packed in a box. These are a MUST HAVE! Especially for the great low price!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: It’s decent
customer_reviews.text: It provides pain relief but doesn’t stay cold enough for my condition. I feel like it also take a long time to get cold. I use it for my cluster headaches and back issues. I was expecting it to be a little bigger but it’s still pretty easy to hold and use.
customer_reviews.author: Metee

customer_reviews.title: Tickles, edges come in contact with the skin.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband for me to use on him to help relieve my hands from having to rub his back. It tickles him!!!! I'm not very ticklish and it got me a couple times too lol. It did get some good spots but if I need to push down more, the side rolls over and the edge touches the skin. I was hoping these were going to be really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Krystalianistic

customer_reviews.title: I wish this worked like planned
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these.. The idea behind this makes a lot of sense. I wanted to be able to give massages without my hand cramping up. When I first started using them, some weird material started clumping up and getting everywhere. I'm guessing the ball has some coat of weird stuff on it. Getting passed that, the ball is too small. It sinks right into the skin and the handle then scrapes the skin as you're rolling it.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing Quality
customer_reviews.text: These seem like they'll work well enough, but the ball is pretty rattle-y in the case and they're more lightweight than I would like. The edge of the case (the part that would be closest to your skin while massaging) is also fairly sharp from the molding process and seems like it might scrape painfully with deeper massage. I'm not totally happy with these. I'm still debating on whether I'll keep them or return them to get another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made! Gets deep into the muscles, releases tension and feels great! I brought this to work and used it on all of my coworkers! They love it and plan to order one, in fact some ordered from this link tonight! Highly recommend this. Makes the job easier for whoever massages you and feels great! Also enjoy using it on myself in areas I can reach!
customer_reviews.author: Ace Roellig

customer_reviews.title: Kinda scratches you but does the job
customer_reviews.text: in the soft tissue of your back it will scratch you because the ball doesnt come out far enough leaving a small gap thats sharp. It doesnt hurt but not really nice in a middle of a massage. Three stars for price
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Rodwell

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick people who like fifteen to deep pressure!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good as long as you are thin! I'm thick and when I use them on my legs with anything more than light pressure they just sink in and pinch me. My boyfriend, who is thin, loves them. As a licensed massage therapist I do think they are nice tools for a cheap price
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis is no longer an issue. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These massagers are awesome. They feel amazing on the skin. They roll with ease and fit perfectly in my wife's tiny hands. She has arthritis in her hands so she's unable to give me a massage withe her hands alone. These balls are the perfect way around that issue. We highly recommend these massagers to anyone looking for a great massage and anyone with hand issues who give massages.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H.

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow and other pains
customer_reviews.text: Using these for tennis elbow. They work great, easy to grip and can really massage deep with pressure. If you use a little lotion/oil, it helps reduce the friction. Also helps to heat the sore area first.
customer_reviews.author: just a browser

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made and don't work. Very loose and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Flea market garbage. Don't know why they bother making these.
customer_reviews.author: James Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: One star because the roller ball recedes too far into the housing during use to effectively maintain contact with skin.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Worth it 100% even to use alone
customer_reviews.text: These things are weirdly AWESOME! I wasn't expecting them to live up to the hype, but they do. Great for both self massage or to use on someone else. I have bony weak hands and it doesn't even matter- these little gems do the hard work.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect post wrist surgery
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my wrist and have to massage the scar regularly to breakup the scar tissue. Manual massaging tires out my hand so quickly. I do manual first and once my hand gets tired, I use this for a while and it feels great. I have nerve damage in that wrist so it can be sensitive, but this works well for me. My husband has taken the second one and regularly rubs his shoulders and neck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellee

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea but the base of the rollers aren’t flat and are made of a slippery plastic I would have preferred a silicone or other nonslip material as the base moves around while I’m working on my shoulders
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateMaven

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it's been dropped and previously used
customer_reviews.text: Opened out of the box last night and it looks like one of them has been dropped, or I received a previously used item since there's a big scuff on the side.
customer_reviews.author: OllieWilk

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy. The plastic can be a little rough if it touches your skin. The balls do roll smoothly which is wonderful. If you apply to much pressure your skin catches a little between the plastic and the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad I bought these. Gave one to my daughter and son-in-law so they can give each other a massage. Great for self massage on hands, arms, neck ,hips upper quads, etc. I use it often because I work out daily.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It works, but...
customer_reviews.text: It can grab and pinch your skin. Its better used as a cloths on type of quick relief. It will provide deep tissue massage, but its not perfected in grabbing skin.
customer_reviews.author: David Remillard

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Hubby likes it but it's not all that easy to hold if you have arthritis or long fingers. I should have went with a Larger set because there hard to hold and I cut my fingers on my own nails trying to keep my hands at just the right position when using them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefer my lacrosse ball to these.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be easier to maneuver being inside of an encasement. They actually are, however, the effectiveness is not what it is with an actual lacrosse ball. The ball is too far in the encasement to get good pressure on the muscle. I was going to return them but I was 1 day late on the time frame, ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth a try
customer_reviews.text: I mean, this is a really inexpensive option and if your problem is a strain muscle, it's definitely worth a shot. While it didn't help my wife's shoulder, it did help my lower back. Really seems designed for short term help.
customer_reviews.author: patrick c

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for two pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice! Good deal. If you have a bit of fat and push too hard you can get pinched....so i wish i could press harder or that the ball protruded more but its good.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are great because my husbands hands get tired when he tries to apply pressure to my back. Make it much smoother then his thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: SMJarvis

customer_reviews.title: Feels great! Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason this got 3 instead of 5 is it needs something grippy on back so it would hold still while trying to do my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold, easy to use, great value
customer_reviews.text: Love these, can be used by yourself or with the help of a partner to relieve that hard to reach back pain without the strain on your(or your partners) fingers. For someone with arthritis I definitely think these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: WeebReviews

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold. Does what it is intended to. Great option when you don’t have the grip or second party to massage your sore muscles.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Love how I can use it where I need
customer_reviews.text: Got it because I hate foam rollers and they don’t help me most of the time and had a hurting hamstring and used this and felt immediately better loved it right away and sent the other to my army boyfriend we both approve
customer_reviews.author: Pazita

customer_reviews.title: Zongs... Is it new or used?
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that the product is scratched and it looks used, not new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worse review I can write!! It does not work and is impossible to use for purposes intended!! Don’t buy this you will be very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Easy, well made!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Easy to use, well made. They roll very nice. Makes massaging so much easier and enjoyable
customer_reviews.author: jenni

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic investment!
customer_reviews.text: These rolling massage balls are the best! It feels fabulous with light and hard pressure. They don’t tug or pinch when used directly on skin. And for the person using the massagers, they don’t hurt your hands or make them cramp up. Probably the best massage tools I’ve come across!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy these. They are not the best quality you will find out there, however for the price you can’t complain. They fit comfortably in my hand. I love the colors.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRShopper

customer_reviews.title: Quality is OK. Not like your quality metal ball
customer_reviews.text: They are OK. Kinda catches the skin and not as easy as I thought they'd be to use on Oneself or another.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: They're ok in a fix. The molding of the plastic had imperfections and it cuts and scratches deep when applying pressure. Not good
customer_reviews.author: Shuree Susanne wolf

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: These are not only pretty, but they work very well for aches and pains
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: much easier to hold than the yoga balls i usually use, although they dont apply the same pressure. i use when my hand/wrist is tired for achilles/calf self massage.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra O.

customer_reviews.title: Too small and can pinch at times
customer_reviews.text: Wish these were a little bigger so it can be easier to use. If you push too hard on it, it may pinch you. I was using it for my tailbone area and thighs and would often get pinched by it when adding pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Luane

customer_reviews.title: Drool worthy
customer_reviews.text: Even when my husband rolls over my spine on accident it doesn’t hurt unlike other massage tools. These are going to be perfect during labor since his hands get tired while he’s massaging me.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Syrek

customer_reviews.title: Surface Pain Reliever
customer_reviews.text: I got these to deal with a knot I have in my upper leg. It definitely is good for surface pain but if you want to get really deep this might not be the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These thing so great. It can hurt your hands to give someone else massage dont always have the right pressure touch. Not anymore these are amazing. Can't push too hard, Always even pressure and you can really work a knot out. Like better than vibrating massager any day
customer_reviews.author: DAWN

customer_reviews.title: Ball doesn’t roll well - cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: These are poor quality. The ball doesn’t roll well and often sticks. I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: emma volkmann

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great for massages!! Either yourself or someone else. They have a hole to put oil in there but I rather not as it will get dirty. But other than that great buy. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Clunk around while rubbing. Smoother when used with oil but then you have to clean.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I had neck surgery a few years ago and I still have a few issues. These are amazing to help with knots and pressure points. My boys love when we use them on their back and legs.
customer_reviews.author: Jsdavidson0407

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: if you have neck upper back feet leg etc pain and cramping, you need this. this is the only product i’ve ever found to actually work. nothing else seems to be hard enough to get the knots out. My body feels so much less tense after using these. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Carol E. Wasson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love these massage balls. My husband has a sore back all the time. We put some oil on them and massage his back and it feels so much better. Easy to use and they come in a nice storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: good buy for price but I have a different one that rolls much better when applying more pressure
customer_reviews.author: Love My Tires

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Love these great use for all my sorness they fit well in my small hands and my hubby's large hands. We have used these almost every day since I got them. Works great with some deep blue massage oil
customer_reviews.author: Amh

customer_reviews.title: Beat investment ever
customer_reviews.text: Best money I spent. My 4yr old loves to message my back with them. Mommy for the win.
customer_reviews.author: Chandellynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, must have
customer_reviews.text: This is so helpful! As someone who has migraine/tension headaches and these help a lot. I wish I had bought these sooner. If you have a cronic pain, this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made!! I am sooooooo happy with these massage balls!! And it is easy to get the little ones involved too, just tell them it’s a game when rubbing them on your back! Haha
customer_reviews.author: Thalia

customer_reviews.title: Great for sore muscles.
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I'm feeling a little stiff this will very well help to relieve it. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice, I thought they were a little bigger but still good. You have to hold them just right or you scrape the sides on the skin and it's not a nice feeling. Great for someone else or yourself
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin &Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse, and a co-worker had some at work. Easy to hold, smooth rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Shellbell

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing on head, neck and back pain. The roller gets spots you can’t with your own fingers and the shape of the device allows you to use it for more than just a minute like you would just using your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Can use on yourself, someone else, heck even the cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought but awesome to use. They really get in there and it’s awesome if you have someone else use both on your back. Heaven.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Dena

customer_reviews.title: Marble not cold enough
customer_reviews.text: Wanted cold material for massage but marble doesnt stay cold enough for long. Returned for steel ball.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davidson

product_meta.title: Massage Ball Manual Roller Massager 2-Pack Self Massage Therapy Tool for Sore Muscles, Shoulders, Neck, Back, Foot, Body, Deep Tissue, Stiffness, Joint Pain Relief  (Blue&Green)
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue&green Are you tired of feeling sore every time you come home? 
Would you like to enjoy a soothing massage without high cost? 
Then the ZONGS Massage Ball is the perfect affordable solution you have been looking for! 
It provides you a stimulating, deep tissue massage, and is designed to reach sore shoulders, neck, upper back, arms, legs and relieve foot pain. 
Perfect for increasing circulation, getting rid of leg cramps, and providing tension relief. 
Simple to use on yourself, or you can have someone else use the massagers on your body to work out those extra deep knots. It slides and glides smoothly on the aching areas, even with your clothes on. 
Of course, you can choose to use oils and massage lotions when using this tool! 
Enjoy the benefits that a good massage can give you, go and get your own Massage Roller Balls today! 


Product Features: 
1-Easy to clean with soap and water.
2-It is small so you can carry it wherever you go.
3-Use it yourself or share it with a friend and great as a gift to family members and friends.


Package Included: 
2 x Massage Roller Balls 
1x Carry Bag
feature_bullets: BEST RELAX TOOL-- As a powerful exercise tool, this massage ball can relieve muscle soreness and promotes body recovery, help relax back stiffness and shoulder sore.

HIGH QUALITY AND MULTI-USAGE --It is a top quality product made from resin, free from peculiar smell and breakable.Can be used over clothes, with massage oils and lotion, For use on dry skin, oiled skin both in the tub or spa.

EASY TO USE-- Unique 360-degree spin design presents you a dreamy soothing massage trip. Just lay back and relax, these rollers will remove the stress and knots by simply rolling right over knots. It is good for arthritis sufferers as no need to use their hands to massage for longer periods of time.

HUMAN DESIGN-- With the sturdy construction,hand grip design, you can control it easily to apply the ideal pressure on tense areas.Each massage ball roller has a small opening on the bottom so you can use your favorite oils or lotions on the massage ball. Only need 1 to 3 drops of your favorite oil or just a few drops of lotion.
BUY WITH CONFIDENCE-- With Amazon Guarantee, and you can return your undamaged product and packaging within 30 days of purchase to receive a FULL REFUND for any reason.
